body:
Hey @carlosantoniodasilva, this is a Rails 4 regression. More evidence here: https://gist.github.com/Empact/5865483 for which the outputs are:

Successful:
```
Active Record 3.2.13
-- create_table(:users, {:force=>true})
   -> 0.1359s
-- create_table(:logins, {:force=>true})
   -> 0.0004s
Bob has 0 logins
Bob has 0 logins
```

Unsuccessful:
```
Active Record 4.0.0
-- create_table(:users, {:force=>true})
   -> 0.1610s
-- create_table(:logins, {:force=>true})
   -> 0.0004s
Bob has 0 logins
./proof.rb:37:in `announce': undefined method `owner' for nil:NilClass (NoMethodError)
	from ./proof.rb:44:in `<main>'
```

Not being able to fully use association extensions when called after scopes is going to significantly limit their usefulness. Should I re-open the pull request on 4-0-stable?
